entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The main character of the story, referred to by Riddle's voice. He is described as being in a state of dying and is surrounded by darkness.

entities.name: fawkes
entities.description: Dumbledore's bird, which is crying tears for Harry Potter. It is described as having glossy feathers and thick, pearly tears trickling down its face.

entities.name: riddle
entities.description: The voice of Lord Voldemort, who is taunting Harry Potter about his impending death. He is described as being distant and gloating about Harry's defeat.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: A character mentioned in the story, referred to by Riddle's voice. He is associated with Fawkes, his bird.

entities.name: lord voldemort
entities.description: The Dark Lord, who is described as having defeated Harry Potter and is gloating about it through Riddle's voice.

entities.name: mudblood mother
entities.description: Harry Potter's mother, referred to by Riddle's voice. She is described as having bought Harry twelve years of borrowed time before he was killed by Lord Voldemort.

relationships.description: Fawkes is crying tears for Harry Potter, indicating a relationship of sympathy and concern between the two characters.
Riddle is taunting Harry Potter about his impending death, indicating a relationship of antagonism and gloating between the two characters.
Lord Voldemort has defeated Harry Potter, indicating a relationship of victory and defeat between the two characters.
